results.title: Manyu-Wana 6
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Golf magic; words for ‘first’ and ‘last” reading of “The Emu is looking for water’; story about bush medicine from ghost gum; dreaming story about country around Vaughan Springs; working as an administrative assistant at the school; making a sling-shot for getting birds; school children on a visit to the country of their dreamings, digging for rabbits, traditional dancing and singing about the country. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 5
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Holly magic; words for ‘happy’ and ‘serious’; reading of a “Story about Echidnas”’ number 8; story about a bush potato dreaming place; more on numbers, using doll magic; dreaming stories about places southwest of Yuendumu; boys and girls painted up and doing fire-dreaming dances; good food; bush animals, vegetables, fruits and seeds; working at the shop; bike magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 4
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Magic; spear-straightening in a fire and hunting for kangaroo; baby magic; words for ‘big’ and ‘little’ using different clothes being washed; collecting red ochre form a cave at Karrku, near Nyirrpi; working at the powerhouse; picking up rubbish; reading of “The Snake and the Goanna”; band magic; Nyirrpi tractor. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 3
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Children playing; dampers magic-number 6; exercising for health, showing football and basketball matches between communitites; spear-throwing at Yuendumu Sports; reading of “The Story about the Snake and the Mouse”; words for ‘heavy’ and ‘light’; colours; cleaning and grinding of bush seeds for seed cakes. Suitable for Primary, seconday and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with Englsih subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media

results.title: Manyu-Wana 2
results.creator_credit: Wendy Baarda, David Batty and Warlpiri Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Working for the Yuendumu Mining Co.; reading of “The Story of the Perentie”; words for ‘far’ and ‘close’; cleaning teeth, washing eyes; fire-making; story about a little kangaroo looking for its mother; shirt magic; number 2. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This program contains the following topics: Magic; number 3; working as a stockman; reading of “The Man and the tree”; number 1; blowing noses; letter “M”; making hairstring; words for ‘wide’ and ‘narrow’; car magic; bat and ball magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: From spirit to spirit
results.creator_credit: Blackfella Films, Four Winds, Min Govat Productions, Nga Kara Whetu, TopShelf Productions and Great North
results.brief_description: An international co-production recognising the indigenous peoples of Australia, Canada, New Zealand and Sweden, made by indigenous filmmakers. The episodes reflect the amazing diversity of cultural tradition and heritage of indigenous communities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Blackfella Films, Four Winds, Min Govat Productions, Nga Kara Whetu, TopShelf Productions and Great North

results.title: Visit from Africa
results.creator_credit: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Documents the visit of two South Africans to Cree tribes in Northern Quebec, Canada, showing how indigenous people forge links to make a better future for themselves by discussing relevant issues.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions

results.title: Keepers of the fire
results.creator_credit: Nola Wuttunee, Brenda Hennig, Andy Thomson and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
This program focuses on the work of four Elders from a North American Indian tribe in Canada, who were survivors of the prison system. After leaving the reserves, it is not uncommon for those who had made the move to the city, to become caught in a vicious cycle within the criminal justice system. The Elders attempt to work with young offenders using their own experiences and knowledge of the traditional way of life, to educate the young people into developing a sense of self worth and hopefully prevent them from becoming caught in a similar cycle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nola Wuttunee, Brenda Hennig, Andy Thomson and Great North Productions

results.title: Making waves = Te upoko o te ika
results.creator_credit: Whetu Fala, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The story of the Te Upoko o te ika, Maori radio station in Wellington, New Zealand. The station fights to survive in a world where ratings and market share are paramount. This program captures one day in the life of a radio station which aims to bring Maori traditions, language and culture to the modern world.
results.title_for_label: Making waves = Te upoko o te ika
results.creator_credit_for_label: Whetu Fala, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
